pros: After the initial intense work, it gets relaxing. Good pension at 70% of your highest income, if you can manage to work full-time for 20 years to qualify.
cons: Hours are not flexible. You might have to teach at 8 am. Limited help or guidance, especially if this is your first time starting as a teacher. Though relaxing after a while, teaching can get quite boring and repetitive. Not to mention, it is poorly paid due to collective bargaining with the union. If you teach a well-paid industry (tech), don't expect your salary to be competitive. The salary ladder is the same for everyone and it takes at least 10-20 years of experience to max out at 98k CAD (full-time). The lowest rank starts at 46k and requires a Master's degree in the subject matter you teach. Getting full-time is extremely difficult. You will most likely be paid 1/4 of the full-time base pay for quite some years. Academic freedom is being jeopardized by the Quebec government. If the province finds your course dangerous to the French language, you will not be allowed to teach it and get laid off.
